intro: Euphorbia hyberna, commonly known as the Irish spurge, is a perennial plant native to the British Isles. It is characterized by its succulent, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in late spring. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its milky sap, which can be irritating to the skin. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows. Its hardy nature makes it a common sight in various habitats across its native range.
